comments.body:
I'm not sure what's going on here. The existing errors indicate that rest *won't* remove 'a' and 'b' because they actually have type string, but the new error makes it look like the resulting type is `{}`, indicating that the rest *did* remove 'a' and 'b'.

Probably the place to start is to declare a new variable instead of trying to redeclare `o`. I don't know if that was intentional in the original test.

Previously we just got computed properties wrong. We effectively ignored them when computing the rest type. Now we actually factor them in, and when a computed property has type `string` (i.e. a non-unit type) we remove _all_ properties from the rest type because we have no idea which ones were actually removed. This mirrors what `Pick<T, Exclude<keyof T, string>>` does.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +61,65 @@!!! error TS2537: Type '{ a: number; b: string; }' has no matching index signature for type 'string'.
                                                            ~
!!! error TS2403: Subsequent variable declarations must have the same type.  Variable 'o' must be of type '{ a: number; b: string; }', but here has type '{}'.
    ({ [computed]: stillNotGreat, [computed2]: soSo, ...o } = o);
                                                        ~
